comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,268 @@
+// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0
+#include "params.h"
+
+.text:
+
+.macro div48    dst, src
+    mov     w8, #43691
+    movk    w8, #43690, lsl #16
+    umull   x8, \src, w8
+    lsr     x8, x8, #37
+    add     w8, w8, w8, lsl #1
+    lsl     \dst, w8, #4
+.endm
+/*************************************************
+* Name:        rej_uniform_asm
+*
+* Description: Full SIMD lane, run rejection sampling on uniform random bytes to generate
+*              uniform random integers mod q
+*
+* Arguments:   - int16_t *r:          pointer to output buffer
+*              - unsigned int len:    requested number of 16-bit integers
+*                                     (uniform mod q)
+*              - const uint8_t *buf:  pointer to input buffer
+*                                     (assumed to be uniform random bytes)
+*              - unsigned int buflen: length of input buffer in bytes
+*              - unsigned int *consumed: the length of consumed buffer
+* Returns number of sampled 16-bit integers (at most len)
+**************************************************/
+.align 4
+.global     rej_uniform_asm
+.global     _rej_uniform_asm
+rej_uniform_asm:
comment.body: Don't you need some preamble/postamble for stack stash/restore?

pull_request.title: Add NEON assembly for rejection sampling
pull_request.body:
[//]: # (SPDX-License-Identifier: CC-BY-4.0)
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->

Improve the performance of Rejection Sampling. 

I should re-arrange the instructions, but I think when we have SLOTHY figures our the best instruction sequences, so I left it as future work. 

Performance improvement: average 8%. 

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Any PR adding a new feature is expected to contain a test; the test should be part of CI testing, preferably within the ".github/workflows" directory tree. Please add an explanation to the PR if/when (why) this cannot be done. -->

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review. -->

comment.body: There's no need to do this here -- you can allocate stack as needed in the ASM?

comment.body: You're right, I'm thinking of using `memcpy` to copy data from stack to `r`,  so I forgot to move the stack and memcpy to asm.
